intro: Aganope polystachya, commonly known as the hairy leaved aganope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of small white or pale yellow flowers, which are arranged in dense, branched clusters. Aganope polystachya is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
